the session is on natural wonders and

patient who at the time was 73 told he

it's part of what enables people to

they got worse and worse from one year

Americans are eating more fat than ever

Dr Atkins and I debated each other many
times before he died and we agreed that
Americans eat too many simple carbs the
the bad carbs and these are things like

you get a double whammy you get all
these calories that don't fill you up
because you've removed the fiber and
they get absorbs quickly so your blood

foods but to go from bad carbs to what
are called good carbs and these are
things like Whole Foods or unrefined
carbs fruits vegetables whole wheed
flour brown rice in their natural form
are rich in fiber and the fiber fills
you up before you get too many calories
and it slows the absorption so you don't
get that rapid rise in blood sugar so
and you get all the disease protective
substances it's not just what you
exclude from your diet but also what you

not bad for you they are good fats and

you find in me if you don't remember

now we're about to publish the first
study uh looking at the effects of this
program on prostate cancer and uh in
collaboration with SLO ketering and with
UCSF and we took 90 men who had biopsy
proven prostate cancer and who had
elected for reasons unrelated to the
study not to have surgery so then we
could randomly divide them into two
groups and then we could have one group
that is a non-intervention control group
to compare to which you can't do with
say breast cancer because everyone gets
treated
what we found was that after a year none
of the experimental group patients who
made these Lifestyle Changes needed
treatment whereas six of the control
group patients needed surgery or
radiation when we looked at their PSA
levels which is a marker for prostate
cancer they got worse in the control
group but they actually got better in
the experimental group and these
differences were highly significant and
then I wondered was there any
relationship between how much people
changed their diet in lifestyle
whichever group they were in and the
changes in PSA and sure enough we found
a dose response relationship just like
we found in the arterial blockage in our
cardiac studies and in order for the PSA
to go down they had to make pretty big
changes I then wondered well maybe
they're just changing their PSA but it's
not really affecting the tumor growth so
we took some of their blood serum sent
it down to UCLA they added it to a
standard line of prostate tumor cells
growing in tissue culture and it
inhibited the growth seven times more in
the experimental group than in the
control group 70 versus 9% and finally I
said I wonder if there's any
relationship between how much people
changed and how much it inhibited their
tumor growth whichever group they happen
to be in and this Rel got me excited
because again we found the same pattern
the more people changed the more it
affected the growth of their tumors and
finally we did MRI and Mr spectroscopy
scans in some of these patients and the
tumor activity is shown in red in this
patient you can see clearly it's better
a year later along with the PSA going
down so if it's true for prostate cancer
it'll almost certainly be true for
breast cancer as well and whether or not
you have conventional treatment in
addition if you make these changes it
may help reduce the risk of recurrence
the last thing I want to talk about
appropo of the issue of the pursuit of
happiness is that study after study have

depressed and depression is the other
real epidemic in our culture are many

depression is treatable we need to do

most selfish thing that we can do just
to look at one study this was done by
David Spiegel at Stanford he took women
with metastatic breast cancer randomly
divided them into two groups one group
of people just met for an hour and a
half once a week in a support group
where was a nuring loving environment
where they were encouraged to let down
their emotional defenses and talk about
how awful it is to have breast cancer
with people who understood because they
were going through it too they just met
once a week for a year 5 years later
those women Live Twice As long and you
can see that the people and that was the
only difference between the group it was
a randomized control study published in
the lanet other Studies have shown this
as well so these simple things that
create intimacy are really healing and
even the word healing comes from the
root to make whole the word yoga comes

to bring together and the last slide I

this Swami that I studied with for so

Wellness Circle the first two letters
and to me it's just a shorthand of what

community and love is really healing and
then we can enjoy our lives more fully
without getting sick in the process
